references.paper_title: Sinkhorn distances: Lightspeed computation of optimal transport
references.reason: This paper introduced entropic regularization to the classic optimal transport problem, which led to significantly more efficient algorithms and a paradigm shift in the field.
This comprehensive overview of computational optimal transport provides foundational knowledge and many of the tools used in the current paper.
This paper introduced the notion of bisimulation metrics, which are shown in the current paper to be equivalent to optimal transport distances.

references.paper_title: An algorithm for quantitative verification of probabilistic transition systems
references.reason: This paper provided a fixed-point characterization of bisimulation metrics, which is used in the current paper to establish a connection between bisimulation metrics and optimal transport.

references.paper_title: Bicausal optimal transport for Markov chains via dynamic programming
references.reason: This paper provided a dynamic programming formulation for computing optimal transport distances between Markov chains, which is used as a starting point for the current work.
